awd_titl_txt: Trace Gas Absorption w/Chemical Reaction with Falling Drops
awd_abstract_narration: This study focuses on the absorption and oxidation of acid gases in             water droplets.  These processes are important in theunderstanding of           acid rain and the design of air pollution control devices.  The                 theoretical analysis and mathematical modelling of these processes will         be performed, as will an experimental investigation.   The fluid flow           fields and the mass transfer with chemical reaction which occurs in             single drops and two drop sets will be analyzed.  These submodels will          form the basis of a comprehensive analysis of trace gas absorption with         chemical reaction in falling drops. Two research papers dealing with            the research effort will be submitted to the Chemical Engineering               Journal and Chemical Engineering Science.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
